Bolter.description: A standard Godwyn Pattern Bolter.  This blessed weapon is used by most Adeptus Astartes.

Stalker Pattern Bolter.description: The Stalker Bolter is a scoped long-range variant of the standard Bolter. Depending on the specific modifications made by the wielder, the Stalker Bolter can serve as a precision battle rifle or a high-powered sniper weapon.

Inferno Cannon.description: A huge, vehicle mounted flame weapon that fires with explosive force.  The resevoir is liable to explode.

Sarissa.description: A vicious combat attachment that is attached to Bolters, in order to allow them to be used in melee combat.

Company Standard.description: A banner that represents the honour of a particular company and will bolster the morale abilities of nearby Space Marines.

Integrated Bolters.description: Integrated Bolters are a set of Bolter weapons that are integrated or built directly into the structure of the vehicle,armour or Dreadnought.

Power Fists.description: While not quite as strong as two Power Fist, these artifacts allow the use of an additional, third weapon.

Storm Shield.description: A powered shield that must be held with a hand.  While powered by the marines armor it shimmers with blue energy.

Boarding Shield.description: Used in siege or boarding operations, this shield offers additional protection.  It may be used with a 2-handed ranged weapon.

Power Sword.description: A preeminent type of Power Weapon.  When active the blade becomes sheathed in a lethal haze of disruptive energy.

Power Axe.description: Similar to the Power Sword, this weapon can be activated to sheathe the axe-head in a lethal haze of disruptive energy.

Power Fist.description: A large, metal gauntlet surrounded by an energy field.  Though large and slow it dishes out tremendous damage.

Lightning Claw.description: Created by attaching several long, energized blades to a standard power fist.  Allows better ripping and tearing.

Combat Knife.description: More of a sword than knife proper, this tough and thick blade becomes a deadly weapon in the hand of an Astartes.

Chainsword.description: A standard Chainsword.  It is popular among Assault Marines due to the raw power and anti-armor capabilities.

Chainaxe.description: A weapon most frequently seen in the hands of Chaos, this Chainaxe uses motorized chainsaw teeth to maim and tear.

Eviscerator.description: An obscenely large Chainsword, this two-handed weapon can carve through flesh and plasteel with equal ease.

Eldar Power Sword.description: ?What's mon-keigh like you doing reading a description like this?

Power Weapon.description: A large, metal gauntlet surrounded by an energy field.  Though large and slow it dishes out tremendous damage.

Lascutter.description: Origonally industrial tools used for breaking through bulkheads, this laser weapon is devastating in close combat.

Chainfist.description: Created by mounting a chainsword to a power fist, this weapon is easily able to carve through armored bulkheads.

Force Weapon.description: An advanced, psychically-attuned close combat weapon that is only fully effective in the hands of a psyker.

Thunder Hammer.description: This weapon unleashes a massive, disruptive field on impact.  Only experienced marines can use Thunder Hammers.

Close Combat Weapon.description: While a variety of melee weapons are used by dreadnoughts, this power fist with flamer is the most common.

CCW Heavy Flamer.description: While a variety of melee weapons are used by dreadnoughts, this power fist with flamer is the most common.

Plasma Gun.description: A 2-handed firearm that launches bolts of plasma. They are considered both sacred and dangerous, occasionally overheating.

Archeotech Laspistol.description: Known as a Lasrod or Gelt Gun, this pistol is an ancient design of Laspistol with much greater range and power.

Bolt Pistol.description: A smaller, more compact version of the venerable Boltgun. Standard Godwyn pattern.

Heavy Bolter.description: An enormous Boltgun. This weapon can fire a hail of powerful, armor-piercing bolts at the enemy.

Storm Bolter.description: Compact, and double barreled, this bolt weapon is inaccurate but grants an enormous amount of firepower.

Flamer.description: Blackened at the tip, this weapon unleashes a torrent of burning promethium- all the better to cleanse sin and impurity with.

Incinerator.description: This flamer weapon includes special promethium and sacred oils.  It is particularly effective against Daemons and their ilk.

Heavy Flamer.description: A much larger and bulkier flamer.  Few armies carry them on hand, instead choosing to mount them to vehicles.

Meltagun.description: A relatively quiet weapon, this gun vaporizes flesh and armor alike.  Due to heat dissipation it has only a short range.

Multi-Melta.description: Though bearing longer range than the Meltagun, this weapon's great size usually restricts it to vehicles.

Sniper Rifle.description: Fires a solid shell and boasts powerful telescopic sights, allowing the user to target enemy weak points and distant foes.

Assault Cannon.description: A heavy, rotary auto-cannon frequently used by Dreadnoughts and Terminators.  Has an incredible rate of fire.

Autocannon.description: A rapid-firing weapon able to use a wide variety of ammunition, from mass-reactive explosive to solid shells.

Missile Launcher.description: This heavy weapon is capable of firing either armor-piercing or fragmentation rockets.  Has low ammunition Count.

Lascannon.description: A formidable laser weapon, this lascannon can pierce most vehicle or power armor from a tremendous range.

Conversion Beam Projector.description: The Conversion Beam Projector is a heavy energy weapon that harnesses advanced technology to project a concentrated beam of destructive energy. It is capable of cutting through armour, vehicles, and even heavily fortified structures.

Hellrifle.description: Normally used by Radical Inquisitors, it appears an antiquated rifle but fires razor-sharp shards of Daemonic matter.

Scout Armor.description: A non-powered suit made up of carapace armor and ballistic nylon.  Includes biohazard shielding, nutrient feed, and camoflauge.

MK3 Iron Armor.description: An ancient set of Armorum Ferrum.  Has thicker armor plating but the added weight slows down the wearer.

MK4 Maximus.description: Armor dating to the end of the Great Crusade.  Often considered the ultimate Space Marine armor.  The components are no longer reproducable.

MK5 Heresy.description: A Hastily assembled Power armour during the Horus Heresy to act as a stop gap. Excels at melee, alongside some downsides.

MK6 Corvus.description: Relatively old beakie armor, sleek as can be.  Boosted olfactory and auditory sensors increase the ranged accuracy of the wearer.

Mk8 Errant.description: Highly modified MK7, this armor has additional protection along the neck and cables.  It is oft worn as a symbol of high rank.

Power Armor.description: A suit of Adeptus Astartes power armor.  The Mark can no longer be determined- it appears to be a combination of several types.

Artificer Armor.description: Heavily modified by the chapter artificers, and decorated without compare, this ancient Power Armor is beyond priceless.

Terminator Armor.description: The toughest and most powerful armor designed by humanity.  Only the most veteran of Astartes are allowed to wear these.

Tartaros.description: Even more advanced than the Indomitus Terminator Armor, this upgraded armor offer greater mobility at no cost to protection.

Dreadnaught Armor.description: A massive war-machine that can be piloted by a honored Space Marine, who otherwise would have fallen in combat.

Jump Pack.description: A back mounted device containing turbines or jets powerful enough to lift even a user in Power Armour.

Plasma Bomb.description: A special plasma charge, this bomb can be used to seal underground caves or Destroy enemy structures.

Exterminatus.description: A special plasma charge, this bomb can be used to seal underground caves or Destroy enemy structures.

Psychic Hood.description: An arcane hood that protects the psychically trained from enemy psychic powers and enhances their control.

Narthecium.description: An advanced medical field kit, these allow those medically trained to heal or recover Gene-Seed from fallen marines.

Rosarious.description: Also called the 'Soul's Armor', this amulet has a built-in, powerful shield generator.  They are an icon of the Imperial Creed.

Iron Halo.description: An ancient artifact, these powerful conversion field generators are granted to high ranking battle brothers or heroes.  Bearers are oft looked to for guidance.

Servo Arms.description: A pair of powerful, mechanical arms.  They include several tools that allow trained marines to repair vehicles rapidly.

Master Servo Arms.description: This master servo harness includes additional mechanical arms and tools, allowing a greater capacity and rate of repairs.
